Linda needed help practicing for the school play.
Linda asked Matthew and Amanda for help, but both said no.

Linda blamed Matthew more than Amanda for not helping.

Who is Linda's less close friend?

Robert needed help fixing his flat tire.
Robert asked Ashley and Jessica for help, but neither did.
Robert didn't manage to fix the tire by himself.

Robert blamed Ashley more than Jessica for not helping.

Who is worse at fixing tires?

James and Margaret each had a birthday party in separate weeks.
Neither invited David to the party.
David later learned from a friend that one of them intentionally didn't invite him, and another forgot to invite him.

David blamed James more than Margaret for not inviting him to his birthday party.

Who intentionally didn't invite David?

Dorothy needed help reaching something on a high shelf.
Dorothy asked Steven and Anthony for help, but both said no.
Dorothy wasn’t able to reach the item.

Dorothy blamed Steven more than Anthony for not helping.

Who is taller?

Nancy needed someone to make an appointment for her.
Nancy asked Donna and Andrew to call and wait on hold for her.
Donna and Andrew both gave up before their call was picked up.
Nancy later learned that one of them waited for a few minutes, and another waited for hours.

Nancy blamed Donna more than Andrew for hanging up.

Who waited for hours before giving up?

Deborah was assigned to do a group project with Emily and Carol.
Their group did a bad job and received a failing grade for the assignment.

Deborah blamed Emily more than Carol for the group's failing grade.

Who didn't try very hard on the assignment?

Edward needed help carrying a very heavy couch.
Edward asked William and Charles for help, but both said no.
Edward wasn’t able to move the couch on his own.

Edward blamed William more than Charles for not helping.

Who is weaker?

Barbara needed someone to mow the lawn.
Richard mowed the lawn.
Joshua did not mow the lawn.

Barbara blamed Joshua for not mowing the lawn.

Who mowed the lawn?

Mark was on a tug of war team with Michelle and Mary.
Their team lost the game of tug of war.

Mark blamed Michelle more than Mary for their loss.

Who didn't try very hard?

Joseph needed help making dinner.
Neither George nor Sandra helped.

Joseph blamed George more than Sandra for not helping.

Who didn't know that Joseph needed help making dinner?

Donald, Brian, and Sarah were having a picnic.
Both Donald and Brian brought snacks with peanuts in them, even though Sarah was allergic to peanuts.

Sarah blamed Donald more than Brian for bringing snacks with peanuts to the picnic.

Who knew that Sarah was allergic to peanuts?

Michael fell over while playing soccer with Elizabeth and Betty.
Both Elizabeth and Betty stepped on Michael.

Michael blamed Elizabeth more than Betty for stepping on him.

Who stepped on Michael on purpose?

Karen always packs herself a lunch to bring to work.
One day, John ate Karen's lunch.
A different day, Kenneth ate Karen's lunch.

Karen blamed John more than Kenneth for eating her lunch.

Who ate Karen's lunch on purpose?

Christopher texted Kimberly and Paul to pick him up from the airport.
Neither responded to his text.
Christopher later learned that only one of them saw his message.

Christopher blamed Kimberly more than Paul for not helping.

Who saw the text message?

Patricia had a birthday party.
Patricia asked Melissa and Jennifer to come, but neither came.

Patricia blamed Melissa more than Jennifer for not coming.

Who is Patricia's closer friend?

Thomas needed help moving.
Thomas asked Kevin and Lisa for help, but both said no.
Thomas wasn't able to move his stuff on his own.

Thomas blamed Kevin more than Lisa for not helping.

Who is Thomas's less close friend?

You may be asked a number of different questions about making judgments and intepreting people’s actions. All information collected will remain confidential.

Risks and benefits: Risks involved in this study are the same as those normally associated with using a computer (e.g., mild eye/arm strain). If you have any pre-existing conditions that might make reading and completing a computer-based survey strenuous for you, you should probably elect to not participate in this study. If at any time during the study you feel unable to participate because you are experiencing strain, you may end your participation without penalty. We cannot and do not guarantee or promise that you will receive any benefits from this study. Your decision whether or not to participate in this study will not affect your employment, medical care, and/or grades in school.

Time involvement: Your participation in this experiment will take 15 minutes.

Payment: If recruitment materials indicate payment (e.g., Amazon or other recruitment), you will receive compensation as indicated.

Subject's rights: If you have read this notice and have decided to participate in this project, please understand your participation is voluntary and you have the right to withdraw your consent or discontinue participation at any time without penalty or loss of benefits to which you are otherwise entitled. You have the right to refuse to answer particular questions. Your individual privacy will be maintained in all published and written data resulting from the study.

Contact information: If you have any questions, concerns or complaints about this research study, its procedures, or risks and benefits, you should ask the Protocol Director, (Professor Tobias Gerstenberg, Phone: (650) 725-2431; Email: gerstenberg@stanford.edu).

Independent contact: I f you are not satisfied with how this study is being conducted, or if you have any concerns, complaints, or general questions about the research or your rights as a participant, please contact the Stanford Institutional Review Board (IRB) to speak to someone independent of the research team via email at irb2-manager@lists.stanford.edu, or via phone at (650) 723-2480 or toll free at 1-866-680-2906. You can also write to the Stanford IRB, Stanford University, 3000 El Camino Real, Five Palo Alto Square, 4th Floor, Palo Alto, CA 94306.

Lisa, Karen, and James were having a picnic.
Both Lisa and Karen brought snacks with peanuts in them, even though James was allergic to peanuts.

James blamed Lisa more than Karen for bringing snacks with peanuts to the picnic.

Who didn't know that James was allergic to peanuts?

Daniel needed help carrying a very heavy couch.
Daniel asked Donald and Kimberly for help, but both said no.
Daniel wasn’t able to move the couch on his own.

Daniel blamed Donald more than Kimberly for not helping.

Who is weaker?

Charles needed help moving.
Charles asked Edward and Anthony for help, but both said no.
Charles wasn't able to move his stuff on his own.

Charles blamed Edward more than Anthony for not helping.

Who is Charles's closer friend?

Brian needed someone to make an appointment for him.
Brian asked Elizabeth and Betty to call and wait on hold for him.
Elizabeth and Betty both gave up before their call was picked up.
Brian later learned that one of them waited for a few minutes, and another waited for hours.

Brian blamed Elizabeth more than Betty for hanging up.

Who waited a few minutes before giving up?

Paul needed help making dinner.
Neither Deborah nor Melissa helped.

Paul blamed Deborah more than Melissa for not helping.

Who didn't know that Paul needed help making dinner?

Dorothy was assigned to do a group project with Margaret and John.
Their group did a bad job and received a failing grade for the assignment.

Dorothy blamed Margaret more than John for the group's failing grade.

Who didn't try very hard on the assignment?

Kenneth was on a tug of war team with Matthew and David.
Their team lost the game of tug of war.

Kenneth blamed Matthew more than David for their loss.

Who didn't try very hard?

Susan mowed the lawn.
Sandra did not mow the lawn.

Mark blamed Sandra for not mowing the lawn.

Who mowed the lawn?

Nancy asked Steven and Mary for help, but both said no.

Nancy blamed Steven more than Mary for not helping.

Who is Nancy's less close friend?

Christopher blamed Linda more than Kevin for not helping.

Michelle asked William and Donna for help, but both said no.

Who is shorter?

Joshua asked Sarah and Patricia for help, but neither did.
Joshua didn't manage to fix the tire by himself.

Joshua blamed Sarah more than Patricia for not helping.

Who is worse at fixing tires?

Who forgot to invite Thomas?

Who ate Barbara's lunch accidentally?
